body:
I ended up riding a bit further than yesterday. It was warmer today and earlier in the afternoon so there were a lot more people on the paths.

I’m finally getting used to the new scooter and enjoyed just cruising at 15 kph with the EarPods playing music in spacial audio mode. I should try reducing the regenerative braking a few points; it’s too much for most inclines.
I was near the COVID testing centre, so went up to have a look. The queue was very long extending back to Holmead Road!
Katherine wanted KFC. The testing queue length had not changed.
Anita has gone to get tested this morning. The lines was long even then. The whole process took almost two hours. Anita will now have to wait at home until the results are available.

Katherine has a student-free day today and tomorrow is the start of the remote learning programme.

I have an MRI appointment at Cooparoo. I have to be there at 1:15pm and had to fast from 9:00am.
I parked in the shopping centre nearby. It’s free for the first two hours, then $2.00 for the next hour.

I’m here for the Prostate MRI. I had to fast beforehand and a suppository was required to make sure there was nothing in the way of the scan.

There will also be a contrast infusion as part of the procedure.
Anita wanted more bread and milk. I got a few other things while I was there.
Picked up the 3D printer. It was too big for the parcel post box, so I had to go into the post office to retrieve it. It was heavy so I used a shopping trolley to get it to the car.

Mum is not doing very well. She couldn’t even talk when I was there. I spent a few hours cleaning up her desk. I also was looking for Katherine’s last letter to her, but couldn’t find it anywhere. I’ll keep looking tomorrow when I go there again.

I had to wear full PPE gear and it was really hot in it.
Picked up the 3D scanner from my Parcel Locker.

Went to see mum again this morning. She was talking at least, but is still very weak. 

The mobile medical team made a visit and spoke to me about mums prognosis. The decision was made to leave mum to be cared for at Arcare. They need to continue to try and get her to drink and eat.
Massive headwinds and gusts. I had to use dual motors most of the way against the breeze.

Went to work to see Loren about her multi-site work situation. She works as a receptionist at a GP at Milton. She has very minimal contact with patients. Since her sleep work also involves no patient contact I will let her work next week.

I don’t think I really was this quick. The evidence for a problem is the shorter distance recorded.

A strong tailwind was less of a problem than the trip into work.

Went back to see Mum with Katherine coming too. She recognised Katherine but still has trouble with me.

I eventually found the information that the Japanese Consulate was after and will send it to them tomorrow. We still didn’t find Katherine’s letter.
I drove Anita to the Chemist and waited in the car.
We ordered two flat whites and a toasted banana bread.

I decided to take the bicycle for an exercise run. It makes more sense than the scooter in a lockdown. The front tyre needed pumping up before setting off. It’s a good thing I decided to check the pressures!

I went to see how mum was getting on. She wasn’t as good as yesterday. I watched her breathing while she was asleep and noticed she was obstructing. I asked the nurses to try and keep her off her back tonight. I rolled her over on her side and she slept much better.
I made up 2 satchels of meso soup and took it to mum. She only had about 100mls. It’s as if she’s forgotten how to swallow; she kept sticking her tongue out.

Charged up the LEAF at IKEA. I chargers it to 100% which may have been a mistake. It only used about 7% to get home so the battery is sitting at 93% for longer than I would like. Hopefully the cold night has rescued the battery?

Despite being a warmer day, the air was still cold and as soon as the sun went down it was freezing! I rode slowly more to keep the wind chill lower!

There were lots of families out on the paths and parks this afternoon.
The LEAF was still at 93% when I left for Arcare

Anita came with me to see my mother. She was more alert today so maybe eliminating the positional OSA helped?

I brought a Japanese bowl and she was able to drink the water from it.

They said they were able to give her a bowl of soup this morning.

A longer scooter ride today. (54V - 48V) Being the weekend there were a large number of people on the paths, even as the light faded.

I’m adapting gradually getting used to the dual motor mode. It’s still the scooters ‘ludicrous’ mode.

I have to practice emergency stops more. A cat ran out in front of me today and you are never prepared for that.
Katherine had a new menu item called the “three-piece Satisfryer”. I ordered one as well.
Anita went to MacDonalds and I ordered a grilled Chicken salad. It had 7 mini-tomatoes in there! I saved half for later as I didn’t have breakfast very long beforehand.
The WRX was less than half full. Petrol is expensive today; nearly $2.00 per litre!
The Forester needed fuel as well
It was dark on the way back home. The spotlight lights up everything, so riding in the dark is no problem, except going around corners.

It was a 23km scooter ride today. The COVID lockdown finished at 4:00pm; 15 minutes after I set off. I was getting a bit bored with riding the same path all the time. Now I can finally go anywhere (in Queensland) although just Brisbane would be OK.
Katherine wanted chicken nuggets from MacDonalds; so this trip brings every vehicle we have to the Ampol station.

Totally slept-in this morning so Katherine was late for school. We arrived at the school at around 8:45am.

The roads were wet and it was raining lightly during the drive.
My usual bacon and egg McMuffin meal deal with coffee
All the heavy traffic on the way to the school, totally disappeared on the way home.

Mum is worse today. Her fingers are purple and the nurses can’t get a saturation reading on their oximeter.

I decided to make a trip to QCH and pick up one of ours.

Since the round trip to work and back would use a fair bit of battery capacity, I dropped in at IKEA to top up. There was a Tesla there. Fortunately he was already at 95% after 50 minutes. I talked to him a little. His name was Michael.
Arc crashed at Arcare yesterday. I think I left there about 9:00pm to come home. I was charging the phone on the TV in mums room, so I should have checked it before I left.
Mums perfusion is so low I had a lot of trouble getting any reading at all. I changed to MAX sensitivity and that helped a lot. At least it was getting a reading about 50% of the time.
So I’ve really been home since around 9:30pm.
Tried to use the Coles EV charger, but it was not powering the car. Maybe it was because I had turned on the car? It needs to be off!
I went to Coles to get some Meiso Soup for mum. I got some other groceries while sitting was there.
Prepared the soup and packed it with a bowel to take to Arcare.

Velma and Marilyn were there when I arrived. Mum was about the same; maybe a little more awake through the day. She still not really eating or drinking.

The Uniting Church minister came to see mum in the afternoon and said a prayer with mum. I don’t know that she knew what was going on, but it was a very emotional time.
I dropped in to IKEA to top up the LEAF. As usual there was someone ice-ing an EV parking spot. The young woman gave me the finger as she got in the back of the car. Rude people.
There was a 7 minute wait for the fried chicken. We were in the LEAF so I was happy to wait. It was really busy there with food delivery people waiting as well.
Katherine had her French Horn tutorial via ZOOM so Anita suggested we go to Red Rooster and then eat up at the Mt Gravatt Lookout.
We couldn’t stay long because the security guard had come up to close the lookout at 7:00pm.
The night nurse at Arcare just called to inform me that mum had passed away early this morning.

We went in to view mum laid out in her bed. It was a very sad moment. We put mums valuable items and papers into shopping bags to bring home.

The local funeral director from George Hartnett Metropolitan Funerals called while we were driving to Arcare.
Big grocery shopping trip.
I had to attach a battery so Arc crashed a few times and lost some data. The trip was actually around 32kms.
I plugged in to the charger this morning while I had my MacDonalds breakfast. It worked today.
I had the meeting with the funeral director. I wanted to have the service at the Uniting Church, Coopers Plains. I also picked out the  coffin and the flowers that go on top of the coffin.
Anita agreed that I could go and pick up Katherine. I still had 30mins to wait so I drove to Rochedale shopping centre to wait where the mobile signal was much better.
I picked a shady section of the covered carpark and waited there until I could go a get Katherine.
The church carpark was full so I had to find somewhere down the side street to park.
Had a meeting with the Uniting Church minister on the details for the funeral service.
I convinced Anita to go for a walk in the evening. It’s something she does in the mornings on weekends. I need to get a bit fitter for the general anaesthetic next Friday.
This scooter ride traversed a lot of footpaths today. It handles them extremely well.
Stopped in the park at a shady spot under the trees.
Anita and Katherine were already at the shops. Katherine wanted to buy some clothes for the funeral.

I asked the shop assistant at Myers if the had any Savane trousers my size. She looked up the computer and found two at Myers, Carindale.

After that I went to DAISO to buy some document holders and my own couch blanket.
Remembered to go the different way. The traffic lights were green most of the way so the whole trip only consumed 12% SOC. This included the stop off at MacDonalds.
Bought a replacement pair of grey Savane Trousers. 92S?
I was there long enough to accumulate 2kWh of charge. There was a Renault ZOE there. They are rare in Australia.
Restocked my medicines and bought 2L Zymil.
If all the people not wearing a mask in the store was a guy buying Codral!
Arc wasn’t running for most of the drive to school.
Used the scooter to go to the chemist to pick up my Pulmocort inhaler.
I bought a wet and dry workshop-style vacuum cleaner.
Katherine is getting her first dose of Pfizer vaccine today. Anita went with her and I waited in the LEAF in the carpark.
Refueled the Forester
Fasting from midnight Thursday for the Prostate biopsy today. Anita woke me up at 5:00am.
Forgot my antibiotic capsule! Anita has gone back to get it. She managed to go home and return in 30 minutes! They asked the doctor and I took it at 7:28am
I charged up the LEAF battery to 100% for all the driving Anita has to do today. With the extra trip to Greenslopes it will be down around 60% now.
I had the prostate biopsy and it was the right time to have the antibiotic afterall. I don’t remember anything after I was wheeled into the operating theatre and woke up in the recovery room.
Anita picked me up in the LEAF and drove me home. I’m not allowed to drive for another day, so the plan is to stay home tomorrow as recover.
Katherine’s QYO rehearsals have resumed. I came along for the ride and were 30 mins early today

I went along for the ride again to pick up Katherine from the old museum. I think this is the most time I’ve spent in the passenger seat in years! The LEAF is a very comfortable place to be a passenger, except for the procedure I had.

The charger stopped at 69% so something went wrong. I just tried to add a credit card to the payment choices and also got an error, so their server probably went down?

There was a Mitsubishi Outlander plugged into one of the rapid chargers, but it had finished some time before. When we got back to the LEAF, the Outlander was still there. It’s a charging bay, not a parking bay!
I spent the whole time trying to find them but always being a few minutes behind.
Anita and Katherine went to QBD bookstore for a book for school. I looked for some shirts, but the queue was too long to bother.
We drove to Spotlight at Mt Gravatt. Katherine needed more stuff for her mask project and I went to the chemist to get some more masks
Anita and Katherine went to Spotlight and I went to the chemist to buy another box of masks.

We drove past Mt Gravatt Showgrounds and saw the hot dog stand had returned. We pulled in and I bought two regular hotdogs with onions. The hotdogs were from the other van to the one that sold the Dagwood dogs, however they had to get the onions from the first one.

The strange fellow who followed me home in the LEAF was there and he recognised me.
We bought four 100 litre storage containers to take to Arcare to pack mums stuff.
We did a big grocery shopping today. The meat is expensive; we bought $32.00 for a few steaks.
I also picked up a parcel from a parcel post locker.  It was the extra flexible filament I ordered.
I bought three more long-sleeve business and casual shirts for work.
Took the scooter down the side path to the sand bank on the creek to take some photos. It handles the dirt track with no issues. The high deck height and the wide tyres help a fair bit.
Stopped at the bridge near the rapids and took some photos, but they were unremarkable. There were two kids down at the creek with their huge dog.
Back home. It’s not as dark as in previous rides so the days are starting to get longer.
Paid the second and final instalment of the funeral service fees this evening. Now I have to start letting all the agencies know when my mother passed away.
Had a sausage and egg McMuffin for a change. I also requested 2 sugars for the small coffee; MacDonalds coffee is too bitter for one it seems.
I parked there and had breakfast to wait out the traffic peak.
Clearing out mums room at Arcare. I brought the four 100 litre containers and started filling them. I left before starting on the wardrobe.
Marie-jo came over to give me a present of a bonsai tree. Everyone put something in the card.
We went back to Arcare in the Forester to pick up more of the containers. Anita tackled the wardrobe using the cardboard boxes provided by the home.
Picked up an official copy of mums death certificate from the funeral service office.
Really windy today!

Got some more packing tape. Also bought a wifi document scanner and a slide scanner. Even if it’s not a good scanner it will be ok as a slide and film viewer.

I nearly bought a chrome laptop for around $300. The screen wasn’t quite 1K though at 1300x920. There appears to be an Android version of jump desktop so that would make a chrome more useful.
Just bought a coffee
Since I was already in the car I offered to pick up Katherine.
We packed more of the remaining clothes and brought them home in cardboard boxes. There’s not much left for tonight - just the rubbish and her wheelchair.

I managed to only consume 9% on the school-run in the LEAF. That’s 4-5% less than usual. Anita has claimed this consumption in the past and I didn’t believe her. I can only put it down to slow traffic and not having to stop for most of the traffic lights?

I called the bank and they froze her accounts. They will now wait for the administrator to contact them.

I also sent a message to the Queensland trustee.
Katherine’s shoes were delivered under the front verandah.
I used the scooter to get to the specialist appointment. It saves me a lot of money not having to pay for parking.
I had my eyes checked and new glasses fitted and ordered for $750 for both trifocal and computer glasses. I’m didn’t want auto-chromatic lenses this time.
Bought a new HP X360 14A Chromebook. It was on 20% discount so was cheap. It does have a 1920 x 1024 resolution 14” display and some USB ports.
We packed up the last of mums stuff into more cardboard boxes. David is meeting me there at 11:00am.

I went back to dismantle and remove the IKEA cupboard. I took off the doors first and amazingly we had missed all the stuff still in the bottom of the cupboard!

David came over to help. He couldn’t come in because he wasn’t vaccinated, so I put the cupboard on my trolleys and brought it outside to dismantle.
After putting all the pieces of the cupboard in David’s SUV, we headed over to the coffee club for lunch.

I got a USB-C to HDMI adaptor for the new Chromebook for $45.00. It works in the RHS port but not the one on the LHS.

There was a large queue at the checkout today with no one social distancing.

I decided to investigate where the new Type-2 chargers were located. I found them around the back of the office in the covered parking area.

I added some photos to the PlugShare app.
It was really cold this afternoon, so I didn’t ride as far as I might have liked to do.
Katherine wanted a Reds box with no sauce on the burger.
Anita wanted to go for a drive, so we went to  Cleveland Point for dinner. Whiting and salad.
I should maybe avoid salads with the fish. I ended up in the toilet this morning. Could be the fetter cheese as there was a lot in the Greek Salad.
CT scan of whole body (not legs) today. It’s for staging the prostate cancer. I hope they don’t find anything!
I messed up and went to the wrong X-ray place, but they were able to squeeze me in anyway. It was a quick procedure compared to the other tests, even with the IV line for the contrast medium.

We walked over to the Mt Gravatt Showgrounds to see if the Dagwood Dog vendor was open. Nope, so we continued down to the Keema dealership. They only had one Kia Kona EV out the front.

I found the charger. It may be new as the ChargeFox managed site isn’t in the ChargeFox app??
Parked near Jake’s apartment to make it easier at the end of the trip.
Jake came with me on a scooter ride through the city
